column4: Description

Bar is a purpose-built commercial establishment that sells alcoholic drinks to be consumed on the premises. They are characterised by a noisy and vibrant atmosphere, similar to a party and usually don't sell food.
Cafe is generally an informal place that offers casual meals and beverages; typically, the focus is on coffee or tea. Also known as a coffeehouse/shop, bistro or sidewalk cafe.
Fast food restaurant.
An area with several different restaurant food counters and a shared eating area. Commonly found in malls, airports, etc.
Ice cream shop or ice cream parlour. A place that sells ice cream and frozen yoghurt over the counter
A place selling beer and other alcoholic drinks; may also provide food or accommodation.
Restaurant (not fast food).
Campus or buildings of an institute of Further Education (aka continuing education)
For children too young for a regular school (also known as preschool, playschool or nursery school), in some countries including afternoon supervision of primary school children.
A public library (municipal, university, …) to borrow books from.
Public place where you can get training.
A music school, an educational institution specialized in the study, training, and research of music.
School and grounds - primary, middle and seconday schools
An university campus: an institute of higher education
Parking for bicycles
General tools for self-service bicycle repairs, usually on the roadside; no service
Rent a bicycle
A public transport station serviced by busses.
Rent a car
Share a car
Wash a car
A device to inflate tires/tyres (e.g. motorcar, bicycle)
Charging facility for electric vehicles
Ferry terminal/stop. A place where people/cars/etc. can board and leave a ferry.
Petrol station; gas station; marine fuel.
Parking for motorcycles
A place to park cars and trucks.
A place to park a car or truck.
A place where taxis wait for passengers.
A large weight scale to weigh vehicles and goods
ATM or cash point: a device that provides the clients of a financial institution with access to financial transactions.
Self-service payment kiosk/terminal
Bank or credit union: a financial establishment where customers can deposit and withdraw money, take loans, make investments and transfer funds.
A medium-sized medical facility or health centre.
A dentist practice / surgery.
A doctor's practice / surgery.
A hospital providing in-patient medical treatment.
A shop where a pharmacist sells medications
A facility that provides social services: group & nursing homes, workshops for the disabled, homeless shelters, etc.
A place where a veterinary surgeon, also known as a veterinarian or vet, practices.
A venue where a variety of arts are performed or conducted
A gambling venue with at least one table game(e.g. roulette, blackjack) that takes bets on sporting and other events at agreed upon odds.
A place where films are shown (US: movie theater)
A place mostly used for local events, festivities and group activities; including special interest and special age groups. .
A large building that is used to hold a convention
A building specifically used for organising events
A fountain for cultural / decorational / recreational purposes.
A place to drink and dance (nightclub). The German word is "Disco" or "Discothek".
A street furniture containing books. Take one or leave one.
A place for free and not-for-profit activities.
TV radio or recording studio
A theatre or opera house where live performances occur, such as plays, musicals and formal concerts.
A building home to a court of law, where justice is dispensed
A station of a fire brigade
A police station where police officers patrol from and that is a first point of contact for civilians
A box for the reception of mail.
Post office building with postal services
A prison or jail where people are incarcerated before trial or after conviction
Building where the administration of a village, town or city may be located, or just a community meeting place
BBQ or Barbecue is a permanently built grill for cooking food, which is most typically used outdoors by the public. For example these may be found in city parks or at beaches.
A bench to sit down and relax a bit
Drinking water is a place where humans can obtain potable water for consumption. Typically, the water is used for only drinking. Also known as a drinking fountain or bubbler.
A small shelter against bad weather conditions.
Public shower.
Public telephone
Public toilets (might require a fee)
Recycling facilities (bottle banks, etc.)
A single small container for depositing garbage that is easily accessible for pedestrians.
A medium or large disposal bin, typically for bagged up household or industrial waste.
A facility where you, paying a fee, can bring your animal for a limited period of time (e.g. for holidays)
A public visible clock
A marketplace where goods and services are traded daily or weekly.
A church, mosque, or temple, etc.
A machine selling goods – food, tickets, newspapers, etc.
Healthcare provider that provides alternative medicine.
A place offering optometry services.
A place that is not a hospital but instead provides physiotherapy services.
A place that is not a hospital but instead provides psychotherapy services.
Shop selling alcohol to take away
Shop focused on selling bread
Shop focused on selling meat
Shop focused on selling chocolate.
Shop focused on selling sweets or candy
A small local shop carrying a small subset of the items you would find in a supermarket
Shop focused on selling delicatessen (fine foods, gourmet foods), possibly also fine wine. Not to be confused with the US delis.
Shop focused on selling vegetables and fruits.
Shop focused on selling baked sweets like cakes, biscuits, strudel and pies.
Shop focused on selling fish/seafood.
Shop focused on selling tea.
Shop selling wine.
A single large store – often multiple storeys high – selling a large variety of goods.
A small shop on the pavement that sells magazines, tobacco, newspapers, sweets and stamps.
A shopping mall – multiple stores under one roof.
Supermarket – a large store with groceries and other items
Wholesale/warehouse club or cash and carry - a store that sells items in bulk to retailers.
Shop focused on selling bags.
A small shopping outlet, especially one that specializes in elite and fashionable items
Shop focused on selling clothes and/or underwear (other related value in use is fashion)
Shop focused on selling fashion accessories.
Jewellers shops.
Shop focused on selling shoes.
A place where clothing is made, repaired, or altered professionally, especially suits and men's clothing
Shop focused on selling watches.
A charity shop is a shop operated by a charity, for the purposes of fundraising.
A shop buying and selling used clothes and other things.
A variety store retailer is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, sometimes with a single price point for all items in the store.
A non-hairdresser beauty shop, spa, nail salon, etc..
Shop focused on selling cosmetics
Here you can get your hair cut, coloured.
A shop, where you can buy hairdressing supplies.
Shop focused on selling herbs, often for medical purposes.
A massage shop
Shop focused on selling medical supplies.
Shops that sells one or more nutritional supplements (of vitamins, minerals and/or herbs)
Shop focused on selling eyeglasses, contact lenses (may also check your eyes).
A tattoo parlour.
Shop focused on selling large electrical items (aka white goods) washing machines, fridges, cookers, ovens, fans, etc.
Shop focused on selling bouquets of flowers.
Shop focused on selling building supplies including screws, bolts & paints
Shop focused on selling keys
Shop focused on selling paints.
Shop focused on selling antiques.
Shop focused on selling beds, mattresses and other bedding products.
Shop focused on selling carpets
Shop focused on selling furniture, might range from small decorational items to a whole flat interior
Shop focused on selling interior decorations.
A shop where you can plan and buy your kitchen.
Shop focused on selling computers, peripherals, software, …
Shop focused on selling consumer electronics (TV, radio, …). Larger ones may also sell computers, fridges, …
Shop focused on selling mobile phones and accessories
Shop focused on selling bicycles, bicycle equipment and may rent or repair them
Car store – a place to buy cars or to get your car repaired
Shop focused on car repair.
Shop focused on selling auto parts, auto accessories, motor oil, car chemicals, etc.
Shop focused on selling motorcycles and/or related accessories, clothes, parts, and rental services.
Shop focused on selling camping, walking, climbing, and other outdoor sports equipment (GPSes, etc.)
Shop focused on selling sporting goods.
Shop focused on selling tyres/tires.
Shop which sells works of art. May be paintings, sculpture, or other types of art
An arts and crafts supply store. Commonly sold items are paper, canvas, paint, pencils, crafting wood, crafting tools, etc.
Shop focused on selling frames.
Shop focused on selling board games, card games and/or role-playing games.
Shop focused on selling recorded music (vinyl/CDs/...)
Shop focused on selling musical instruments, lyrics, scores.
Shop focused on selling video games.
Shop focused on selling books (not a library).
Shop focused on selling gifts, greeting cards, or tourist gifts (souvenirs)
Shop focused on selling office supplies
A shop for party and festival supplies, like costumes, etc.
self storage
Shop focused on selling toys.
Shop focused on selling tickets for travelling. Also known as a tour operator.
A shop to get your normal clothes washed. Might be self service coin operated, with service staff for drop off, …
Shop focused on selling photocopying and printing services.
Shop or kiosk offering a clothes dry cleaning service. The actual cleaning may be done elsewhere.
A shop for pets, animals and toys or food for them.
A shop offering grooming services for pets (most frequently dogs)
Unspecified historic building.
A historic/retired cannon. Usually found on forts or battlefields.
A designated historic district.
A military fort, a stand-alone defensive structure which differs from a castle in that there is no permanent residence.
Small memorials, usually remembering special persons, people who lost their lives in the wars, past events or missing places.
A memorial object, which is especially large, built to remember, show respect to a person or group of people or to commemorate an event.
Remains of structures that were once complete, but have fallen into partial or complete disrepair.
A decommissioned ship/submarine which generally remains in one place.
A structure where somebody has been buried.
A venue with pay-to-play games.
A dance venue or dance hall.
A place to play disc golf.
A designated area, with or without a fenced boundary, where dog-owners are permitted to exercise their pets unrestrained.
A fire ring or fire pit, often at a campsite or picnic site.
Fitness centre, health club or gym with exercise machines, fitness classes or both, for exercise.
An outdoor facility where people can practise typical fitness exercises.
A place where flowers and other plants are grown in a decorative and structured manner or for scientific purposes.
A facility for mooring leisure yachts and motor boats.
A protected area of importance for wildlife, flora, fauna or features of geological or other special interest.
A park, usually in an urban (municipal) setting, created for recreation and relaxation.
A table with benches for food and rest.
An area designed for practising a particular sport, normally designated with appropriate markings.
A playground: an area designed for children to play.
A slipway: a ramp for launching a boat into water.
A sports centre is a distinct facility where sports take place within an enclosed area.
A major sports facility with substantial tiered seating.
A swimming pool (water area only).
A track for running, cycling and other non-motorised racing such as horses, greyhounds.
A furnished apartment or flat with cooking and bathroom facilities that can be rented for holiday vacations.
A public piece of art.
An object of interest for a tourist, or a purpose-built tourist attraction.
A tent or caravan pitch location within a campsite or caravan site.
An area where people can camp overnight using tents, camper vans, or caravans.
A place where you can stay in a caravan overnight or for longer periods.
An area or building that displays a variety of visual art exhibitions.
Accommodation smaller than a hotel and typically owner-operated, such as bed&breakfasts etc.
Cheap accommodation with shared bedrooms.
Hotel – an establishment that provides paid lodging.
Information for tourists and visitors, including information offices.
Short term accommodation, particularly for people travelling by car.
A museum: an institution with exhibitions on scientific, historical, cultural topics.
A locality that is suitable for outdoors eating, with facilities to aid a picnic such as tables and benches.
A place worth visiting, often high, with a good view of surrounding countryside or notable buildings.
A steak house.
A restaurant that sells barbecue.
A restaurant that smells ramen.
A restaurant specializing in French cuisine.
A restaurant specializing in Mediterranean food.
A restaurant specializinng in Korean food.
A restaurant primarily serving breakfast foods.
A restaurant specializing in selling burgers.
A restaurant specializing in selling sandwiches.
A restaurant specializing in selling indian food.
A restaurant specializing in selling asian food.
